result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul M. Fletcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Paul M. Fletcher was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Paul M. Fletcher is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Paul M. Fletcher was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Paul M. Fletcher was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed/stayed 9 months county jail. 159 days credit.
Court approves probation transfer to Brown County. Court will work w/ DOC if/when the need for probation to be transferred out of the State of WI.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through. If what defendant has already completed satisfies the DOC agent, no need to complete again.

No contact w/ JNB, her residence or be within a 5 mile radius of her residence.
No possession of firearms.

Absolute sobriety.
No possession/consumption of alcohol, controlled substance w/out a valid Rx, and/or drug paraphernalia.
Restitution of $1,081.61 plus surcharges totaling $1,249.26 payable w/ cash bond posted.
Court costs of $263 and DNA surcharge of $200 each count payable w/ cash bond posted. Submit DNA sample. Supervision fees payable to DOC during probation.

State's Exhibit #1 - restitution claim

1:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Paul M. Fletcher in court.  Attorney Stephanie M. Rock in court for Paul M. Fletcher. VWC Rachael Race in court. Victim in court. Court makes stmt. Victim rights. Stmt by VWC Race. Court address victim. Court makes stmt regarding restitution claim. Defendant opposes restitution claim. Off record. 2:01 PM. Court resumes 2:07 PM. Appearances remain the same. State calls victim to testify to restitution claim. State's Exhibit #1 marked. Victim testifies to State's Exhibit #1. Cross exam by Atty Rock. Court questions victim. Witness excused. State offers State's Exhibit #1 into evidence. Court receives. Argument by Atty Rock objecting to full amount of restitution. Court grants restitution in full w/ surcharges as filed by the State. $1,081.61 total. Court makes stmt. Court has read all character letters filed. VWC Race reads stmt written by victim. State recommendations. Atty Rock makes stmt. Defendant makes stmt. Court makes stmt. Court sentence. Count 4: Imposed/stayed 9 month county jail and placed on probation for a period of 2 years. Count 5: Imposed/stayed 90 days plus 6 months county jail consecutive to count 4 and placed on DOC probation for a period of 2 years. Conditions of probation: AODA assessment and follow through, absolute sobriety, no possession consumption of alcohol, controlled substance w/out valid Rx and/or drug paraphernalia, no contact w/ victim JNB, her residence or be within a 5 mile radius of her residence, no possession of firearms, restitution of $1,081.61 w/ surcharges totaling $1,249.26, court costs of $263 and DNA surcharge of $200 each count, submit DNA sample. Restitution and court costs/fines payable to the COC office w/ cash bond posted. Supervision fees payable to DOC during probation. Court approves probation to be transfered to Brown County. Court will further work w/ DOC to transfer probation out of state if needed.

9:09 AM Defendant Paul M. Fletcher in court.  Attorney Caleb Saunders in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie M. Rock and Attorney John Birdsall  in court for Paul M. Fletcher. Court addresses proposed jury instructions and reviews w/counsel.  State moves to amend information language in ct. 4.  Defense does not object.  Court will amend ct. 4 language.  Defense argues Proposed WIS. J.I.. Crim. 140 to be amended.  Court denies request. Defense to e-file written motion that was argued on the record.  No further objections to proposed jury instructions.  Court adjourns 9:17  Resume 9:29  Court makes Stmt. to final changes to jury instructions and reviewed w/counsel.  Counsel in agreement with instructions.  Jury in 9:33  Court addresses jurors.  Court makes introductions of counsel.  Defense has no further evidence.  State has no rebuttal evidence.  Evidence closed 9:34.  Jury instructions read by court 9:34.  Closing by State 10:11.  Closing by Defense 10:44 Rebuttal by State 11:22.  Jury instructions given by court 11:29.  Bailiff's Sworn in 11:37  Court gives verdict forms and instructions to Bailiff's 11:37.  Jury out 11:38.  Counsel has on objection as to instructions given to jurors.  Court makes stmt. as to text messages that may need to be redacted.  Adj.11:40  Resume 12:11  Appearances remain the same.  Jurors have a  note and it is  marked as Court's Exhibit# 1.  It is reviewed by counsel.  Counsel agree all exhibits except 1, 14, 15 to be given to jurors.  Court responds on note and attaches exhibits which is given to Bailiff for jurors.  Counsel is in agreement.  Adj.  12:14.  Off Record 2:51  Appearances remain the same.  Counsel review note.  On record 2:55  Jurors have a note and it is marked as Court's Exhibit#2.  It was reviewed by counsel w/Court's response and attachment #103 paperclipped.  Given to Bailiff to return to jurors.  Adj. 2:56  Resume 3:39 Off record. Jury in/Resume 3:39  Appearances remain the same.  Verdict read by Court 3:45.  Court addresses Foreman 3:49 Court polls jury 3:50.  Counsel satisfied of polling of Jurors 3:52  Jurors out 3:53 Court accepts verdict 3:54.  Court finds Ct. 1, 2, 3 orders an acquittal and guilty of Ct. 4 and Ct. 5. Adj.  3:56  Resume:  4:02  A sentencing date was picked.  Bond is argued by counsel.  Victim makes Stmt. on the record regarding bond.  Response by State.  Response by Defense.  Court Amends Bond.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Jury in 4:00 p.m.  The State has no further evidence and rests 4:01.  Defense intends to present testimony.  Court addresses jurors as to remainder of case. records.addlTxt: 4:01 PM Defendant Paul M Fletcher in court, in custody. Attorney Nicole Muller appearing on behalf of  Attorney Stephanie M. Rock in court for Paul M Fletcher. Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Rachael R/VWC in court. State has filed information and counsel wishes to proceed w/ ARGN. Information has been reviewed by Atty Muller and defendant. Defendant waives formal reading of the Information and enters pleas of NOT GUILTY to each of the counts. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg and provided a copy of the NOH in court. Present bond cont'd.

3:35 PM Defendant Paul M Fletcher in court, in custody. Attorney Nicole Muller appearing on behalf of  Attorney Stephanie M. Rock in court for Paul M Fletcher. Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Rachael R/VWC in court. Victim rights. State calls Deputy James Hanson who is sworn and testifies. Cross exam by Atty Muller. Witness excused. Evidence closed. Argument by Atty Muller. Defense makes a motion to dismiss felony counts as to the testimony presented in court today and requests the defendant not be bound over. Court makes stmt. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed by this defendant and bound over to the circuit court. Court proceeds w/ ARGN.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
